general: This law makes rules for companies that want to mine things like metals and minerals from the ocean floor. It helps keep our seas safe and healthy, while also allowing businesses to use the resources they need. The law says that companies must follow strict guidelines to protect the environment and marine life. This means that they can't just dig up whatever they want without thinking about how it might affect other living things or the ocean itself. It also ensures that any profits made from deep sea mining are used to benefit everyone, not just a select few.

series.short: Deep Sea Mining Legislation Amendment: UK Compliance with UNCLOS
series.text:
* Simplified point 1: The Deep Sea Mining (Temporary Provisions) Act 1981 has been amended to give effect to obligations of the United Kingdom under Part XI of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea.
* Simplified point 2: The amendments in the Schedule include changes to the extent, commencement, and short title of the Act.
* Simplified point 3: The Act extends to England and Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland, and can be extended to the Channel Islands, the Isle of Man, or any British overseas territory.
* Simplified point 4: The Act comes into force at the end of a two-month period after it is passed.

summary:
Hello! I'm here to help you understand the Deep Sea Mining Act 2014. This law was made to allow the United Kingdom to follow its commitments under an international agreement called the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea.
Here's what the law does:
* It updates an old law called the Deep Sea Mining (Temporary Provisions) Act 1981 to match the new rules of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea.
* It changes some details about when the law will start working and what it will be called.
* The law applies to all parts of the United Kingdom, including England, Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland. It can also apply to other places like the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man if needed.
* The law will come into effect two months after it is passed.
So, in simple terms, the Deep Sea Mining Act 2014 is a law that helps the United Kingdom follow its international agreements related to deep sea mining. It updates an older law and sets out how the law will work in different parts of the country.
single:
* The Deep Sea Mining Act 2014 amends the Deep Sea Mining (Temporary Provisions) Act 1981 to give effect to obligations of the UK under Part XI of the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea.
* The Act extends to England, Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland.
* The Act can be cited as the Deep Sea Mining Act 2014.
* The Act comes into force at the end of a 2-month period after it is passed.
KEY POINTS:
* The Act amends the Deep Sea Mining (Temporary Provisions) Act 1981 to align with UK obligations under the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea.
* The Act extends to the UK and its territories.
* The Act comes into force after a 2-month period.
IMPACT:
* The Act aims to regulate deep sea mining in the UK and its territories in line with international obligations.
* It provides a framework for the exploration and exploitation of deep sea mineral resources.
* It may impact companies and individuals involved in deep sea mining, as well as the environment and local communities.
